alert.note: Alert for McLean (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:52AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McLean County through 115 AM CDT... At 1251 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Towanda, or 10 miles northeast of Bloomington, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lexington and Cooksville. This includes Interstate 55 between mile markers 169 and 186. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
